title: 'Winning time': Florida rallies once again for title
content: Florida rallied from a 12-point deficit to survive a defensive slugfest vs. Houston and earn the program its third national championship since 2006.

title: Houston stunned: 'That broke everybody's heart'
content: Houston squandered a 12-point lead in the second half and finished the national title game with four consecutive turnovers in losing to Florida on Monday night.

title: House settlement inches closer to final approval
content: A judge directed lawyers to address a short list of her remaining concerns about a multibillion-dollar settlement that could reshape college sports.

title: Ohtani falls double shy of cycle in Dodgers' loss
content: Los Angeles star Shohei Ohtani, a three-time MVP, fell a double short of hitting for the cycle Monday night, as the Dodgers dropped a 6-4 decision to the Washington Nationals, a nice bounce-back for the DH after he went 1-for-11 over the weekend.

title: Jenkins sues NCAA for limiting pay while at Nova
content: Through a lawsuit filed last week in New York, former NCAA tournament hero Kris Jenkins is suing the NCAA and six conferences for limiting athlete pay and restricting his ability to capitalize off his name, image and likeness while he was at Villanova.

title: Sources: Miami has discovery rights for De Bruyne
content: Inter Miami CF hold the discovery rights for Manchester City player Kevin De Bruyne, sources have told ESPN, setting up a scenario in which the Belgian playmaker could join Lionel Messi in south Florida.

title: Man admits to selling $250K in fake memorabilia
content: A former California resident pleaded guilty to selling hundreds of thousands of dollars in fake memorabilia.

title: NHL playoff watch: The Rangers' path to the postseason
content: Here's what has to happen for New York to get to the playoffs. Plus, full bracket projections and more.

title: After all the injuries and losses, Bueckers and UConn complete storybook journey
content: After four years of disappointment, Paige Bueckers finally saw her -- and UConn's -- dream come true.

content: As this season's title is won, we take a look at the women's college basketball Way-Too-Early Top 25 for 2025-26.

title: Can Volkanovski prove he's still got it?
content: With Ilia Topuria out of the UFC featherweight picture, the door is open for the next star to walk through at UFC 314.

title: Manchester derby shows City and United flaws, Real Madrid and Liverpool lose, more
content: The Manchester derby showed how far both City and United have to go, while complacency was a theme for both Real Madrid and Liverpool in defeats to Valencia and Fulham, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Sources: Man United to rival Chelsea for Delap
content: Manchester United have identifed Ipswich Town's Liam Delap ahead of Viktor Gyökeres, Benjamin Sesko and Victor Osimhen, sources have told ESPN.

title: Leicester lose record 8th in a row without scoring
content: Leicester City have become the first Premier League team to lose eight Premier League games in a row without scoring a single goal.

title: Pep: Nunes not 'clever enough' to play midfield
content: Pep Guardiola wants Matheus Nunes to develop into a right-back for Manchester City, saying that he is "not clever enough" to play in midfield.

title: Jurić exits Southampton after PL relegation record
content: Southampton have sacked manager Ivan Jurić after the club's relegation from the Premier League, the club confirmed on Monday.

title: Courtois: Madrid wary of Arsenal set-piece threat
content: Thibaut Courtois admitted on Monday that Real Madrid have been working on coping with Champions League opponents Arsenal's set piece threat, but said it's "a matter of time" before Mikel Arteta's team win a trophy.

title: Saka: No rush to sign new Arsenal contract

title: Neymar, Memphis fume as Brazil bans skill move

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi's Miami stay No. 1, Columbus hold on to No. 2 spot
content: A big weekend in Major League Soccer ends with the top three holding steady in our Power Rankings, as Messi and Miami stay top closely pursued by the always tough Columbus Crew and upstarts Vancouver.

title: "Non-Aligned Nations Like India...": JPMorgan CEO's Advice To Donald Trump

title: US Is Quietly Revoking Student Visas From Harvard To Stanford

title: "Allah Kept Me Alive For A Reason, I'm Coming": Sheikh Hasina To Supporters

title: "Historic Verdict...": MK Stalin Welcomes Supreme Court Rap For Governor
content: Tamil Nadu has secured a "historic verdict" from the Supreme Court, Chief Minister MK Stalin said Tuesday, after the court ruled that Governor RN Ravi's withholding of assent for 10 proposed laws is "illegal" and "arbitrary".

title: "No CBI Inquiry Into Teacher Posts": Top Court Relief To Bengal Government
content: The Supreme Court said there will be no CBI inquiry into the Bengal government's creation of extra posts for the estimated 25,000 teaching and non-teaching staff sacked from the School Service Commission after the court voided their selection.

title: "Blackmail": How China Plans To Fight Trump's 50% Tariff Threat
content: "It's blackmail." This is how China decried US President Donald Trump's latest threat to add a further tariff of 50 per cent on its goods as it vowed to fight levies "to the end".

title: BJP Suspends Leader Who 'Purified' Temple After Dalit Congress MLA's Visit

title: Opinion: Will Waqf Bill Be India's New 'Shah Bano' Moment?
content: The Muslim community in India, despite finding its political power diminished today, has shown remarkable patience so far, choosing to lie low and avoid provocation. But the discontent over the Waqf bill threatens to undo this fragile understanding.

title: No Longer Extinct: Dire Wolves Howl Again After 12,000 Years

title: A case for a fair seat allocation
content: Article 1 of the Constitution proclaims that India shall be a Union of States. The term Union implies that the arrangement or rearrangement of the component units should be on the basis of equity. There are serious apprehensions in the south on the question of readjustment of seats in the Lok Sabha

title: Children undergoing cancer treatment in Mumbai and Chennai get chess coaching classes
content: For children undergoing cancer treatment, chess can help prevent potential cognitive decline and promote emotional resilience during their cancer treatment.

Jeremy Schaap meets with the founders of Tater baseball to learn about the mechanisms that make the bat so effective in the MLB . we asked players and coaches to see if they think the bowling pin-shaped bat trend is here to stay .

title: More than a shooter: How Azzi Fudd lifted UConn to title

title: Bizarre injuries, comebacks -- and a whole lot of winning: What we've learned so far about the Dodgers
content: the los Angeles Dodgers secured their first full-season championship in four decades . the team's goal was to build one of the greatest baseball teams ever . they could overcome the randomness of the playoffs, which has prevented a repeat champion each of the past 24 years .

title: 'We've got Walt': How Clayton Jr. willed Florida to a title

title: 2025-26 men’s college basketball rankings: Way-too-early top 25
content: players not ranked in the top 50 of ESPN's 2025 NBA draft rankings are considered a departure . if a projected draft pick commits to another school, we're factoring him into the ranking . we'll adjust a team's ranking if that player opts to return to school .

title: Smith, Carroll have 'unfinished business' in Vegas
content: Geno Smith spoke to reporters for the first time since being traded from the Seattle Seahawks to the Las Vegas Raiders . "when people think about my story, coach Carroll was a big part of that," he said . he played in 37 games under Carroll and threw for 8,641 passing yards, 55 touchdowns and 21 interceptions .

title: How Tetairoa McMillan used volleyball to become a top WR prospect
content: Tetairoa McMillan is a volleyball coach and athletic director at Servite high school in Anaheim, California . the 6-foot-4, 219-pound wide receiver starts with a "step close," the powerful last two steps a player takes while attacking a ball . he tells sportsmail that volleyball is my favorite sport .

title: Is Barcelona vs. Real Madrid the Champions League final we all want?
content: real madrid are struggling, tired from too many games, and badly miss their injured and departed stars . they'll be grinding their teeth angrily at the very idea that it's going to be a Madrid vs. Barça winner-takes-all showdown . the last time Bayern Munich qualified for the final they suffered indescribable pain .

title: Lil Wayne visits Bill Belichick in Chapel Hill, receives UNC football jersey
content: With spring practices in full swing around the country, the  North Carolina Tar Heels  welcomed a visitor with some serious star power over the weekend -- Lil Wayne. The famed rapper visited the Tar Heels' football facilities Saturday in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, where he met head coach Bill Belichick, among others. Two Legends.  pic.twitter.com/7gWVhunTZN Lil Wayne received a custom North Carolina football jersey, with his nickname "Tunechi" and the No. 17, a nod to his roots in New Orleans' 17th Ward. Shhh...The Fireman Coming. 🔥  pic.twitter.com/Q4DLrYlMM1 Lil Wayne is a known  Green Bay Packers   superfan , but he has also expressed support for Belichick in his new position. When the longtime  New England Patriots  coach was  officially hired by  the Tar Heels in December, the artist congratulated Belichick  on social media  -- writing "Man much respect 2da GOAT coach." "Tha Carter VI," Lil Wayne's latest studio album, is slated for release in June.

title: Hi-tech identity fraud: How UP-based gang tampered Aadhaar biometrics in 12 states
content: A hi-tech identity fraud racket, operating from Uttar Pradesh, has been busted for allegedly tampering with biometric data of over 1,500 Aadhaar cardholders across 12 states. Police arrested four individuals who exploited loopholes in the UIDAI system, running a network of agents who collected documents for illegal updates.

title: 'Serious injustice': Rahul urges President to step in amid Bengal teachers job row
content: Rahul Gandhi has urged President Murmu to intervene in the West Bengal teacher recruitment controversy, following the cancellation of over 25,000 appointments due to irregularities. He highlighted the plight of fairly selected teachers facing dismissal and requested the President to ensure their continued employment. Mamata Banerjee criticized the court's decision, alleging a conspiracy against the state's education system.

title: BookMyShow to Kunal Kamra: Not delisted your shows or you as an artist…
content: BookMyShow has responded to allegations of delisting comedian Kunal Kamra's shows, clarifying that it acts as a neutral ticketing platform. The company stated that decisions regarding show listings are made by organizers or venues, not BookMyShow itself. They emphasized their commitment to neutrality and compliance with Indian laws, facilitating ticket sales for diverse events.

title: Gujaratis step into space long shaped by Punjabis in Canadian politics
content: As Canada gears up for its 45th federal election, a notable shift is occurring within the Indian diaspora. While Punjabi-Canadians have long dominated South Asian political engagement, this election sees a surge of Gujarati-origin candidates entering the political arena.

title: Former India cricketer set to join BJP
content: Former Indian cricketer Kedar Jadhav is set to begin his political career by joining the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) at a ceremony in Mumbai. The 40-year-old, known for his contributions to Indian cricket, including a memorable century against England, will be welcomed by key BJP figures, marking a new chapter after retiring from all formats of cricket earlier this year.

title: 'If US wants to talk, it should show respect': China amid fresh tariff threat
content: China has asserted that the United States must demonstrate respect and equality if it genuinely seeks trade talks, following the imposition of tariffs by President Trump. China accuses the US of employing pressure and blackmail, vowing to retaliate against further tariff escalations to protect its interests.

title: Zomato COO resigns with 'immediate effect': Read email to CEO Deepinder Goyal
content: Zomato's food delivery business faces leadership transition as COO Rinshul Chandra resigns, effective April 7, 2025, after seven years with the company. This follows recent departures, including chief people officer Akriti Chopra in September 2024 and Hyperpure CFO Hemal Jain in December. Chandra cited pursuing new opportunities as his reason for leaving the company.

title: MP cops walk a tightrope as 'Dr Death' John Camm boasts of 15k+ cardiac surgeries
content: Madhya Pradesh police arrested N John Camm, also known as Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav. He is accused of performing illegal surgeries. These surgeries allegedly led to patient deaths. Police are investigating his medical qualifications. They are verifying his claim of performing 15,000 cardiac operations. Authorities are checking his MBBS degree and past work at hospitals.

title: 3 dead, 7 injured as 'drunk' driver goes on rampage in Jaipur
content: A speeding SUV claimed three lives and injured seven others in Jaipur's Nahargarh area on Monday night. The vehicle rammed into pedestrians and other vehicles, causing chaos. Among the deceased are Avdesh Pareek and Mamta. Locals apprehended the driver and handed him over to the police.

title: Forget Studio Ghibli, use ChatGPT to turn pics into realistic action figure
content: A new trend is making waves online. Users are using ChatGPT to turn photos into action figures. The AI tool can create Lego characters and Simpsons characters. It can also create Pixar-style portraits. Users can upload a photo and describe the desired character. ChatGPT then generates a customized action figure image. Users can further customize the image as needed.

title: '3 J&K outfits disassociate from Hurriyat', announces Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that three more political groups, including the Jammu Kashmir Islamic Political Party, have cut ties with the separatist Hurriyat Conference. Shah highlighted this as a sign of growing trust in the Indian Constitution within the valley. He noted that eleven organizations have now abandoned separatism, reinforcing the vision of a united and powerful India.

title: Career guidance for XII students held in Melvisharam near Arcot
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the day .

title: Sensex rallies over 1,600 points: Top 5 reasons
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in opening trade on Tuesday a day after the terrible stock market crash. While BSE Sensex went above 74,700, Nifty50 was above 22,600.

title: Hardik gets emotional after MI's 4th loss, brother Krunal consoles
content: Mumbai Indians faced their fourth defeat in five IPL 2025 matches against RCB, leaving captain Hardik Pandya emotional. RCB secured their first win at Wankhede in a decade, with Krunal Pandya consoling his brother after the close 12-run loss. Hardik had a good day with both bat and ball but didn't get enough support from his teammates.

title: 'Should not act as per political expediency': SC slams TN guv for 'sitting over' bills
content: The Supreme Court has strongly criticized Tamil Nadu governor RN Ravi for withholding assent to Bills passed by the state assembly. The court declared that the governor's actions, including reserving 10 Bills for the President after they were already reconsidered, were illegal and unconstitutional. The court declared these Bills as passed.

title: 2013 Dilsukhnagar blasts case: Telangana HC upholds death penalty for 5 convicts
content: The Telangana High Court has confirmed the death penalty for five Indian Mujahideen operatives involved in the 2013 Dilsukhnagar blasts. The court dismissed their appeal against the sentence, holding them accountable for the twin bombings that killed 18 and injured over 100. A special NIA court in Hyderabad originally issued the death sentences in 2016.

title: 'Ignorant, impolite': China slams US VP JD Vance over 'peasants' remark
content: China has strongly criticised US Vice President JD Vance, labelling his remarks as "ignorant and impolite." This response follows Vance's controversial statement about the United States borrowing money from "Chinese peasants." The Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson expressed surprise and sadness at Vance's words, highlighting the ongoing tensions in China-US economic relations amidst trade disputes and tariff concerns.

title: After purported leaked chats, BJP shares video of 'spat' between TMC MPs
content: BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya shared a video showing a heated argument between TMC MPs Kalyan Banerjee and Kirti Azad at the Election Commission headquarters. The dispute reportedly stemmed from disagreements over submitting a party memorandum, escalating to the point where police intervention was needed.

title: MasterChef India's Gujjuben aka Urmila Asher passes away at 79
content: Urmila Jamnadas Asher, fondly known as Gujjuben or Baa from MasterChef India, passed away at 79. She inspired many by participating in the show at 75 and showcasing her authentic cuisine. Her journey to support her grandson led her to Forbes 50 after 50, leaving behind a legacy of courage and joy that touched countless lives.

title: Israel flag in Ram Navami: How Kolkata marches use other nations’ colours
content: A political controversy erupted in Bengal after an Israeli flag was waved at a Ram Navami rally led by ex-BJP MP Arjun Singh. This event marks a shift from Kolkata's traditional political symbolism, where foreign flags like those of the USSR and Palestine were historically displayed during protests.

title: Joke row: Bombay HC grants relief to Kunal Kamra till April 16
content: The Bombay High Court has addressed a plea from comedian Kunal Kamra, issuing notices to Mumbai Police and Shiv Sena MLA Murji Patel regarding an FIR against Kamra. The FIR stems from allegations that Kamra called Deputy CM Eknath Shinde a "traitor" during a performance.

title: Karan Oberoi rape case: Mumbai court upholds legal proceedings against Pooja Bedi
content: A Mumbai sessions court has refused to halt legal proceedings against Pooja Bedi and seven others in connection to the 2019 Karan Oberoi rape case. The group is accused of revealing the rape survivor's identity during a press conference held at Bedi's residence.

title: How rebalancing investment portfolio at the right time can protect your money
content: Rebalancing the original asset allocation controls risk and can protects your portfolio against the next crash. But just like most retail investors could not control their greed when markets were rising, they may not be able to overcome their fears in the current downturn.

title: SC quashes HC's order for CBI probe into creation of supernumerary teacher posts
content: The Supreme Court partially overturned a Calcutta high court order for a CBI probe into West Bengal's creation of supernumerary school staff posts, but upheld the CBI investigation into the appointment of 25,753 teachers. Chief minister Mamata Banerjee criticised the cancellation of appointments, calling it a conspiracy and assured support for the sacked teachers, even at the risk of imprisonment.

title: 'Mistake on top of a mistake': China hits back at Trump’s additional 50% tariff threat
content: China has strongly condemned the US' threat to escalate tariffs on Chinese imports, labeling it a "mistake on top of a mistake" and an act of blackmail. Beijing vowed to retaliate with countermeasures to protect its interests if the US proceeds with the tariffs. Despite the escalating tensions and tit-for-tat duties, China reiterated its willingness to engage in dialogue.

title: Meerut murder case: 'Accused Muskan found pregnant during routine check-up'
content: Muskan Rastogi, jailed in Meerut for allegedly murdering her husband with her lover, has tested positive for pregnancy in a preliminary examination, jail officials reported. Saurabh Rajput was killed on March 4, and Muskan and her lover, Sahil, are accused of drugging and dismembering him. Authorities are planning an ultrasound to confirm the pregnancy and its duration.

title: Asian markets show signs of recovery after tariff shock: 10 things to know
content: Asian markets rebounded on Tuesday following a global sell-off triggered by escalating US-China trade war fears. Japan's Nikkei 225 surged, while Australian stocks edged higher after Monday's steep decline. China vowed to retaliate against US tariffs, as global markets experienced volatility, with oil prices dipping and gold prices climbing amid investor uncertainty.

title: Furious Virat Kohli throws cap in anger after drop catch, video goes viral
content: During an IPL 2025 match, Virat Kohli's frustration boiled over when a dropped catch by Jitesh Sharma and Yash Dayal gifted Suryakumar Yadav a reprieve. Kohli's visible anger mirrored Rahul Dravid's past outburst. Despite the mishap, RCB secured a 12-run victory against MI, propelled by Kohli's impressive 67 runs, elevating them to third place in the standings.

title: RBI MPC meet: Will governor Sanjay Malhotra cut repo rate?
content: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee convened this week, with expectations of a 25 bps repo rate cut to 6% amidst easing inflation. The decision, influenced by global economic headwinds and potential impacts from US tariffs, will be revealed on April 9, 2025.

title: Doc shares 5 common signs you may have cancer
content: Dr. Tim Tiutan, an oncology hospitalist, highlights five often-dismissed signs of cancer. These include unexplained weight loss, persistent fatigue despite adequate sleep, chronic night sweats and fevers, lumps in the body, and rectal bleeding. While these symptoms can indicate other conditions, Dr. Tiutan advises seeking medical evaluation for proper diagnosis and timely treatment.

title: Pawan Kalyan's son, Mark Shankar, injured in Singapore school fire
content: Pawan Kalyan's son, Mark Shankar, was injured in a school fire in Singapore, suffering injuries and respiratory issues. Kalyan, currently on an official tour in Andhra Pradesh, will complete his commitments before traveling to Singapore to be with his son. Mark's condition is stable, and Kalyan is balancing his family situation with his professional responsibilities.

title: 'Direct assault on Muslims': Waqf Act sparks uproar in J&K assembly for second day
content: The Jammu and Kashmir legislative assembly is witnessing turmoil over the Waqf Amendment Act. Mehbooba Mufti of PDP voiced strong opposition, emphasizing the Act's impact on the rights of Indian Muslims. National Conference also plans a resolution against the Act. People's Conference chief Sajad Lone criticized CM Abdullah's meeting with Union Minister Kiren Rijiju after the Bill's passage.

title: 'I feel for Hardik': Krunal says there was only one Pandya that was supposed to win
content: Krunal Pandya played a crucial role in Royal Challengers Bengaluru's thrilling 12-run victory over Mumbai Indians, securing their first win at Wankhede Stadium in a decade. Bowling the final over, Krunal took three wickets, finishing with figures of 4 for 45. Despite the victory, Krunal expressed empathy for his brother Hardik, acknowledging their strong bond and mutual desire to win.

title: 'Over Rs 33 lakh cr loans given': PM interacts with Mudra Yojana beneficiaries
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday celebrated the 10th anniversary of the Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana by interacting with beneficiaries. He lauded the scheme's role in empowering small businesses, especially women, by providing collateral-free loans. Beneficiaries shared stories of how MUDRA loans transformed their lives, enabling them to become self-reliant entrepreneurs.

title: Pawan Kalyan orders probe into JEE exam disruption due to his convoy
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan has ordered an inquiry following reports that some students missed their JEE exam in Pendurthi due to delays caused by his convoy. Kalyan seeks details on traffic stoppage duration, road conditions, and traffic control measures. He emphasized minimizing public inconvenience during his tours and instructed police to regulate traffic briefly during VIP visits.

title: Watch: Kohli's fiery celebration after Krunal's final over heroics vs MI
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured a thrilling victory against Mumbai Indians at Wankhede Stadium. Virat Kohli's explosive half-century propelled RCB to a formidable total. Krunal Pandya's impressive final over sealed the win. Kohli reached 13,000 T20 runs, joining an elite group of batsmen. Jasprit Bumrah's economical bowling was a positive for Mumbai.

title: Dimple Kapadia makes rare appearance with granddaughter Naomika Saran
content: Legendary actor Rajesh Khanna’s granddaughter, Naomika, has set the internet ablaze with her recent appearance at an event hosted by Dinesh Vijan to celebrate Maddock Films’ 20-year anniversary and its box office success in Mumbai. Many social media users reacted to the video with unique comments.

title: Why did Salman Khan's 'Sikandar' fail at the box office?
content: Salman Khan's 'Sikandar' faced disappointment at the box office. The film struggled to cross Rs 100 crore. Experts cite a weak script and Salman's disinterested performance as key reasons. Even fans were let down by the content. The film's music also failed to resonate. Analysts suggest the industry must prioritise strong along with star power.

title: Indian-origin man accused of sexually assaulting co-passenger on US flight
content: Bhaveshkumar Dahyabhai Shukla, a 36-year-old Indian-origin man from New Jersey, faces federal charges in the US for allegedly sexually assaulting a fellow passenger on an American Airlines flight from Bozeman, Montana, to Dallas, Texas, on January 26, 2025. Indicted for abusive sexual contact, Shukla could face imprisonment, a hefty fine, and supervised release if convicted.

title: Minor offences come back to haunt Indian students in US, told to self-deport
content: US authorities are now revoking visas of Indian students for minor offenses, including traffic violations, after previously targeting them for alleged campus activism. Dozens have received notices from their schools, citing past incidents like lane shifting, drunk driving, and shoplifting as reasons for immediate departure.

title: 'Concussed' career: Aus cricketer, 27, retires after 1 Test
content: Australian cricketer Will Pucovski, aged 27, has retired due to persistent concussion symptoms. He last played in March 2024, suffering a head injury. Pucovski, who played one Test match in 2021, revealed ongoing issues like fatigue, headaches, and motion sickness.

title: 'Fake doctor' accused of killing 7 through botched surgeries arrested
content: Police in Damoh, MP, have detained N John Camm, also known as Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, from Prayagraj, UP. He's accused of unauthorized surgeries at Damoh's Mission Hospital, allegedly causing seven patient deaths. Hired for ₹8 lakh monthly, Camm operated on 13 patients. Authorities are investigating discrepancies in his credentials, including an invalid Andhra Pradesh Medical Council registration.

title: 'Don’t like them, won’t introduce them': Donald Trump's jab at Democrats
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. title: Supreme Court's Landmark Verdict On Governor's Powers In Tamil Nadu Case
content: RN Ravi's decision to withhold assent to 10 key Bills is "illegal" and "arbitrary" the court ruled that the Governor cannot reserve the 10 bills for the president . the ruling is "historic" for the DMK-led government .
